definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: It is a restless society and the era of highly self-conscious.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个社会躁动不安和自我意识极强的时代。

sentences.english: The March wind is fretful, fretting the languid wave into murmurs .
sentences.chinese: 三月的风躁动不安，惹得倦怠的波浪哗哗作响。

sentences.english: The poorer the quality of your life. And the more unstable and unpleasant your moods.
sentences.chinese: 你的身体素质越差，你的情绪就会格外的不安和躁动。

sentences.english: In severe cases, may have irritability, convulsions coma.
sentences.chinese: 重者可有躁动，抽搐式昏迷。

sentences.english: Its work the multi-performance to move restlessly in the psychology, also has the pursue to be peaceful.
sentences.chinese: 其作品在心理上多表现为躁动，又有追求安宁。

sentences.english: I am some Huangs who look forward to the red of the enthusiasm to move.
sentences.chinese: 我有些向往热情的红躁动的黄。

sentences.english: In the quiet,Kane could hear a horse stirring in his stall.
sentences.chinese: 寂静中凯恩听见一匹马在马圈里躁动。

sentences.english: Turkey is full of energy and hormones, and is trying to figure out its new identity.
sentences.chinese: 土耳其充满激情和躁动，试图弄清白其新身份。

sentences.english: The March wind is fretful, fretting the languid waves into murmurs.
sentences.chinese: 三月风躁动不安，把倦怠的波浪搅得满腹怨言。

sentences.english: The ant becomes restless on the hot pot.
sentences.chinese: 蚂蚁在热锅上躁动不安。

sentences.english: Self-control is promoted by humility. Pride is a fruitful source of uneasiness.
sentences.chinese: 谦卑使人能自我控制，骄傲却会结出躁动不安的果子。

sentences.english: But Xixinan residents are fed up with the ruckus.
sentences.chinese: 但世代居住在西溪的居民厌倦了这种躁动。

sentences.english: Up to a point, we can rationalize our pushiness .
sentences.chinese: 认识到这一点，我们才有可能不那么躁动。

sentences.english: The sun was midway across the sky when I noticed how restless Maheegun had become.
sentences.chinese: 太阳正当午时，我突然注意到美尔根躁动不安。

sentences.english: The colored sky breath, filled has enticed and moves restlessly.
sentences.chinese: 花天的气息，充满了诱惑和躁动。

sentences.english: Business processes are volatile and they breed like rabbits.
sentences.chinese: 业务过程变动就像是兔子跳动那样躁动不安。

definition: to begin to stir (idiom)/to get restless/to become threatening
to rage/to dash/to surge/also written 激盪|激荡
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
